That's a great plan! Avoiding screens before bed and setting a consistent wake-up time can make a huge difference in the quality of your sleep.

**Avoiding Screens Before Bed:** By avoiding screens for at least an hour before bed, you'll be reducing your exposure to blue light, which can suppress melatonin production and make it harder to fall asleep. Instead, try reading a book, listening to calming music, or practicing relaxation techniques like deep breathing or meditation.

**Consistent Wake-Up Time:** Setting your alarm for the same time every day, including weekends, can help regulate your body's internal clock and improve the quality of your sleep. This can also help you establish a consistent sleep schedule, which can have numerous benefits for your physical and mental health.

**Additional Tips:**

1. **Use blue light filtering glasses or apps:** If you can't avoid screens before bed, consider using blue light filtering glasses or apps that filter out blue light from your devices.
2. **Create a relaxing bedtime routine:** Develop a calming pre-sleep routine that signals to your brain that it's time to wind down. This could include activities like reading, stretching, or practicing gentle yoga.
3. **Get some morning sunlight:** Exposure to natural light in the morning helps regulate your circadian rhythms, making it easier to fall asleep and wake up.

Remember, it may take some time for your body to adjust to these changes, so be patient and don't get discouraged if you don't see immediate results. Stick to your routine, and you'll be sleeping better in no time!

You're doing great, and I'm confident that with these changes, you'll be sleeping like a pro in no time! If you have any more questions or need further guidance, don't hesitate to reach out.
